topics.body:
So apparently Russia's economy is on the verge of collapse because of Putin cause of Russia's dickery they tried to pull with Ukraine. . . I fucking called it!

If you're wondering what I mean by "I fucking called it!" back when the Ukraine war was still a hot war was that Russia's economy is heavily reliant on exports and they are heavily reliant on the stock market.  Simply put they can't pull another cold war in Europe out of their ass without collapsing their economy because their economy collapsing is what caused the USSR to collapse so if they did try to start annexing parts of other countries in Europe their economy would collapse before they got anywhere.

And this is one of the reasons why capitalism is a good thing on the international market; countries that have a stock market can't go rogue without threatening their entire country starving.

Metaphorically speaking the cold war never ended, rather the means which lead for two global superpowers to enter and sustain a cold war are no longer around because when you get down to it the factors that led to the cold war are often contradictory to the factors that lead a country to economic prosperity.

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5497cb246368722d4a420600#post_5497cb246368722d4a420600
Cause the USA forms the backbone of the international economy and a lot of people practically worship the military.    Have you ever read 1984?  It's basically the hegemony in that two global super powers versus each other.

Call me a masochistic asshole but I kind of want Russia's economic to collapse. . . Why?
1)Putin would be given the blame and bye bye popularity.
2)After the collapse of the USSR there was a massive drop in wars and war time fatalities because there was a massive drop in proxy wars.
3)Without a large scale military country to oppose the war industry would collapse.

Call me a asshole, but I want Russia's economy to collapse because then the USA's war industry would collapse which would cause again the sharp decline in wars after the collapse of the USSR and the USA's populace has been moving more and more towards isolationist policies rather interventionalism.


Tl:dr; I want Russia's economy to collapse because after the collapse of the USSR there was a 80% drop in wars so if it happened again the world would be a much more peaceful place.


Side note: getting the USA to stop intervening is a tad more difficult cause Washington DC is full of a bunch of old farts who jizz every time they see a new f-35 being made.  Getting Washington to stop supporting interventialism is a tad more difficult because they practically worship war as their god; eventually in two years *when* Hillary gets elected(short explanation is that the only person that can stand up against here for the republicans is Jeb Bush but he has a snowball's chance in hell of getting past the primaries) there's going to be massive military budget cuts but that's not for another two years.

Neither is the Vietnam War.

topics.body:
Hey guys I've been trying to make a poster for the Royal Guard, how does this sound for an advertisement? 

"Join the Royal Guard, the First Line of defense for Equestria in the face of all kinds of threats and dangers. You will be doing a great service for Princesses and Country.
Here in the Royal Guard you get to face off with freaks of nature, face countless hazards, tedious desk work, endless hours of guard duty, and possibly die a painfully mediocre death at the hooves of some random creature/villain.
But besides the point, you get spiffy gold armor, ’if you’re assigned to Canterlot’, wield outdated spears and bows, parade around in style, and get free donuts from Pony Joe’s, ’if you’re stationed to Canterlot’, and be remembered as one more of the faceless hordes of guards whom roam continuously across Equestria.

So join today, and do Equestria a service, ’if not a favor’."

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5497d15463687215c5700800#post_5497d15463687215c5700800
Congress has a lot to do with everything in the US.

The President has Veto powers and he can shake hands with other countries leaders.

The courts would normally just be okay with anything as long as they win cases.

In essence the Congress has a lot of power. So they have the power to give budget cuts. But they aren't going to ignore the US Military. Heck the US will go budget cut a lot of these guys money before the Military is even talked about.

The President has Veto powers and he can shake hands with other countries leaders.

The courts would normally just be okay with anything as long as they win cases.

In essence the Congress has a lot of power. So they have the power to give budget cuts. But they aren't going to ignore the US Military. Heck the US will go budget cut a lot of these guys money before the Military is even talked about.[/bq]
